thread.title: O'Malley promises action on immigration - CNNPolitics.com
thread.title_full: O'Malley promises action on immigration - CNNPolitics.com

title: O'Malley promises action on immigration - CNNPolitics.com
text:
CNN.com
O'Malley seeks to outflank Clinton on immigration By Dan Merica, CNN Updated 2235 GMT (0535 HKT) June 3, 2015 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos Former Democratic Maryland Governor Martin O'Malley addresses the 2015 International Association of Fire Fighters on March 10. Hide Caption 1 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley has not been shy about potentially running in 2016, saying about potential competitors Jeb Bush and Hillary Clinton that the presidency is not a "crown" to be passed through families. Hide Caption Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos In some early 2016 polling, O'Malley is pulling single-digit numbers. Hide Caption 3 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley speaks during the 2015 Alfred K. Whitehead Legislative Conference and Presidential Forum on March 10. Hide Caption 4 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley speaks at a Democratic fundraiser at Gibson's Bookstore and True Brew Cafe on March 6 in Concord, New Hampshire. Hide Caption 5 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley speaks during a ceremony commemorating the bicentennial of the writing of The Star-Spangled Banner at Fort McHenry National Historic Park on September 13, 2014. Hide Caption 6 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley delivers remarks before Barack Obama takes the stage at a Costco store January 29, 2014 in Lanham, Maryland. Hide Caption 7 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley addresses a conference commemorating the 10th anniversary of the Center for American Progress on October 24, 2013. Hide Caption 8 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley speaks during the National Clean Energy Summit 6.0 on August 13, 2013 in Las Vegas. Hide Caption 9 of 11 Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley and his wife Katie O'Malley arrive for a State Dinner in honor of British Prime Minister David Cameron at the White House on March 14, 2012. Hide Caption Moments from Martin O'Malley's career 11 photos O'Malley campaigns for reelection on October 27, 2010, in Frederick, Maryland. Hide Caption 11 of 11 Washington (CNN) Martin O'Malley , days into his presidential campaign, promised to reform the United States' immigration system in the first 100 days of his hypothetical presidency. Speaking to the United States Hispanic Chamber of Commerce on Wednesday in Washington, the former Maryland governor was asked by Javier Palomarez, the group's president, whether he would pursue reform within the symbolically important time span. "Absolutely," O'Malley said. The governor argued the issue was not only one of fairness for the millions of immigrants who currently live in the United States without legal documentation, but one that is "essential for our American economy." JUST WATCHED
